summary: This is an email chain from June 1, 2020, regarding the Epstein case. An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York requests assistance in delivering recent bank subpoena returns from FirstBank Puerto Rico to a case agent, to be left at 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza. The recipient confirms they can handle the coordination.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting assistance in delivering bank subpoena returns related to the Epstein case to a case agent.

events.title: Coordination for Bank Subpoena Returns Delivery
events.description: An email exchange where an Assistant U.S. Attorney requests and confirms coordination to deliver recent bank subpoena returns from FirstBank Puerto Rico to a case agent for the Epstein investigation.

locations: 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated June 1, 2020, concerning the Epstein case investigation.
It involves a request from an Assistant U.S. Attorney for assistance in delivering recent bank subpoena returns from FirstBank Puerto Rico to a case agent.
The planned delivery location is 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza in New York, the address for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The document indicates ongoing investigative activity related to financial records in the Epstein case as of mid-2020.
